intro: Myriopus subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved myriopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny flowers. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Myriopus subsessilis is adapted to withstand drought and is considered a resilient species in its native habitat.
